hook.text: A painter finished 95% of the job perfectly but missed one small wall. Must the homeowner pay nothing?

buildup.text: Substantial performance means the party performed almost everything required, with only trivial deviations.

discovery.text: Under this doctrine, the performing party can still collect paymentâ€”minus the cost to fix the deficiency.

twist.text: It only applies if the breach was not willful. Deliberately cutting corners kills the defense.

climax.text: Jacob & Youngs v. Kent: a builder used equivalent pipe instead of the specified brand. The court allowed payment.

punchline.text: Close enough can be good enoughâ€”if the shortfall is honest and minor.

quiz.question: When does substantial performance NOT apply?
